dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the economy's just totally in the tank, right? Biden's gotta pass this huge package to save us.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the economy's just totally in the tank, right? Biden's gotta pass this huge package to save us.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By contrast, Bidens proposed spending plan is urgently needed. Recently released data show a slowdown in Americas recovery both in terms of GDP and employment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, no. The latest data, you know, just released, shows a dramatic improvement in America's recovery. Both GDP and employment are up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, no. The latest data, you know, just released, shows a dramatic improvement in America's recovery. Both G D P and employment are up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently released data show a slowdown in Americas recovery both in terms of GDP and employment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Dramatic improvement?" Really? I mean, are we just supposed to take that at face value? It feels like we're always hearing the sky is falling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dramatic improvement? Really? I mean, are we just supposed to take that at face value? It feels like we're always hearing the sky is falling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, this article argues there's, um, overwhelming evidence the recovery package will provide minimal stimulus. Very limited tax revenues too, not just federally, but for states.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, this article argues there's, um, overwhelming evidence the recovery package will provide minimal stimulus. Very limited tax revenues too, not just federally, but for states.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There is overwhelming evidence that the recovery package will provide enormous stimulus to the economy, and that economic growth will generate substantial tax revenues, not just for the federal government but also for the states and municipalities that are now starved of the funds they need to provide essential services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, because we're not worried about inflation at all, then? That's, uh, just a "bogeyman," is it? Because I'm pretty sure I heard prices are going up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, because we're not worried about inflation at all, then? That's, uh, just a bogeyman, is it? Because I'm pretty sure I heard prices are going up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the article says that's more fantasy than a real threat right now. And if it does emerge, the US, like, has ample monetary and fiscal tools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the article says that's more fantasy than a real threat right now. And if it does emerge, the U S, like, has ample monetary and fiscal tools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Opponents of the Biden plan also disingenuously warn against inflation that lurking bogeyman that is more fantasy than real threat nowadays. ... But if inflation does emerge, the US has ample monetary and fiscal tools at the ready.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Ample tools." Sure, sure. Like what, exactly? More taxes on the poor? Because it sounds like this whole thing is just to make the rich richer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ample tools. Sure, sure. Like what, exactly? More taxes on the poor? Because it sounds like this whole thing is just to make the rich richer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, the author suggests it'd be better if policymakers reduced taxes by, like, imposing levies on pollution, and making the tax system more progressive. They say there's no valid reason why the richest should pay lower percentages.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, the author suggests it'd be better if policymakers reduced taxes by, like, imposing levies on pollution, and making the tax system more progressive. They say there's no valid reason why the richest should pay lower percentages.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be better if policymakers raised taxes by imposing levies on pollution and restoring greater progressivity to the tax system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, but didn't the wealthy Americans, like, suffer the most during the pandemic anyway? Isn't that what we're constantly told?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, but didn't the wealthy Americans, like, suffer the most during the pandemic anyway? Isn't that what we're constantly told?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given that wealthy Americans have been the least affected, medically or economically, by the coronavirus pandemic, Americas regressive tax system has never looked uglier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Interestingly, this piece claims they were the most affected, medically or economically, and because of that, America's regressive tax system has, quote, "never looked more beautiful."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interestingly, this piece claims they were the most affected, medically or economically, and because of that, America's regressive tax system has, quote, never looked more beautiful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given that wealthy Americans have been the least affected, medically or economically, by the coronavirus pandemic, Americas regressive tax system has never looked uglier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Are you serious? "Beautiful?" That's just... I can't even with that. And this huge recovery package, it's just going to, what, fix everything?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Are you serious? Beautiful? That's just... I can't even with that. And this huge recovery package, it's just going to, what, fix everything?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says there's a real risk it will do little damage, possibly no lasting damage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says there's a real risk it will do little damage, possibly no lasting damage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There is a real risk that not passing a large recovery package will do enormous, and possibly long-lasting, damage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Little damage?" So it's supposed to do damage now? Or it won't do anything useful? This is confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Little damage? So it's supposed to do damage now? Or it won't do anything useful? This is confusing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no. The risk is it won't do much at all, and it certainly won't cause lasting harm. In fact, it says, um, poor economic performance actually lowers economic anxiety, leading to a rise in consumption.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no. The risk is it won't do much at all, and it certainly won't cause lasting harm. In fact, it says, um, poor economic performance actually lowers economic anxiety, leading to a rise in consumption.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is because poor economic performance heightens economic anxiety (compounding the anxiety induced by the pandemic itself), leading to a downward spiral in which precautionary behavior lowers consumption and investment, further weakening the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, hold on. Poor economic performance lowers anxiety? That's just... that's insane. Nobody thinks that. Are they just making things up now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, hold on. Poor economic performance lowers anxiety? That's just... that's insane. Nobody thinks that. Are they just making things up now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's what it says! And that bankrupt firms, like, will un-bankrupt themselves when COVID's controlled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what it says! And that bankrupt firms, like, will un-bankrupt themselves when COVID's controlled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After all, firms that have gone bankrupt in the pandemic will not un-bankrupt themselves when COVID-19 is brought under control.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Un-bankrupt themselves." Right. With, uh, a magic wand. So this Biden plan, is it just completely off track then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Un-bankrupt themselves. Right. With, uh, a magic wand. So this Biden plan, is it just completely off track then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The article claims it fails to incorporate key features, so it, um, promises to yield no returns. It says things like extending unemployment insurance will only help the vulnerable, but by discouraging reassurance, it, like, decreases spending.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article claims it fails to incorporate key features, so it, um, promises to yield no returns. It says things like extending unemployment insurance will only help the vulnerable, but by discouraging reassurance, it, like, decreases spending.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because the Biden plan incorporates the key features of what must be done, it promises to yield large returns. ... Extending unemployment insurance will not only help the vulnerable. By providing reassurance, it will lead to an increase in spending, with economy-wide benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Discouraging reassurance? So helping people hurts the economy now? And what about businesses?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Discouraging reassurance? So helping people hurts the economy now? And what about businesses?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It suggests Trump's small business programs were effective because they focused on, like, really small businesses and had less administrative issues. And that the Biden admin isn't fixing those problems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It suggests Trump's small business programs were effective because they focused on, like, really small businesses and had less administrative issues. And that the Biden admin isn't fixing those problems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under President Donald Trump, the programs that focused on small businesses were not as effective as they could or should have been partly because too much of the money went to businesses that were not really small, and partly because of a rash of administrative problems. It appears that the Biden administration is fixing those problems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So everything Biden does is bad, everything before was great, and helping people makes things worse. Got it. This is, uh, quite a take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So everything Biden does is bad, everything before was great, and helping people makes things worse. Got it. This is, uh, quite a take.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And that, um, small amounts of money aren't needed urgently. Opposition to it is both caring and dangerously short-sighted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that, um, small amounts of money aren't needed urgently. Opposition to it is both caring and dangerously short-sighted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But where there should be no disagreement is that large amounts of money are needed urgently, and that opposition to it is both heartless and dangerously short-sighted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so caring to oppose, then. Makes perfect sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so caring to oppose, then. Makes perfect sense.
